question.title: The AccessibilityService.onServiceConnected method is not executed after I enable the accessibility service
question.body: When I turn on the Accessibility Service, what I expected is the method “SVR.onAccessibilityConnected” would immediately invoke and then the app would play music loudly and show a window cover the whole screen to prevent user to kill the app aiming to make people embrassed. But when I auctually install and run the app and turn on the accessibility service, nothing happens.In the file "/sdcard/Android/data/com.example.lyt/files/1 log.txt", I don't see "onServiceConnected" printed.After I kill the app and run it again, the window showed and the music start to play. That's weird. How to solve the problem? Here is the source code: https://github.com/CheungThree/happy-evil/blob/master/app/src/main/java/com/example/lyt/temp/SVR.java Here is the apk file: https://github.com/CheungThree/happy-evil/blob/master/app/release/app-release.apk
